type1.text: Did you provide specific examples involving data analysis for business decisions?
Did you clearly explain the business context and objectives?
Did you describe the data sources and how you gathered requirements?
Did you detail the analytical techniques or models you applied?
Did you discuss the key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics?
Did you highlight the insights and recommendations from your analysis?
Did you demonstrate problem-solving by overcoming data quality or stakeholder issues?
Did you showcase collaboration with cross-functional teams or business partners?
Did you highlight skills in data storytelling and presenting findings?
Did you display business acumen and understanding of industry trends?

type2.text: How well did you structure your responses with clear business problems, analytical approaches, and actionable recommendations?
options: Responses were disorganized without a clear structure
Used a basic structure inconsistently or incompletely
Followed a structured format but some points were unclear or missing details
Clearly followed a structured format with appropriate details
Perfectly structured with concise and impactful details

type2.text: How effectively did you demonstrate understanding of the business domain and industry?
options: Examples did not showcase any business or industry knowledge
Mentioned business concepts without depth or context
Displayed working knowledge of the business and industry
Highlighted strong proficiency in applying business acumen to analysis
Provided compelling examples of leveraging deep industry expertise

type2.text: How well did you handle data quality, ambiguity, or stakeholder challenges?
options: Examples only involved clean data and clear requirements
Showed struggles with data issues or stakeholder misalignment
Demonstrated basic techniques like data cleaning or assumption clarification
Showcased ability to apply advanced methods for complex data or requirements
Clearly articulated structured frameworks for tackling data and stakeholder challenges

type2.text: How strongly did your examples highlight business impact and data-driven decision making?
options: Examples did not mention any business impact
Mentioned business problems but solutions were technically-focused
Displayed some consideration of business impacts in approach
Clearly made business objectives and impact the key priority
Provided powerful examples of driving strategic business decisions with data insights

type2.text: How persuasively did you demonstrate skills in data storytelling and communication?
options: Examples were solely technical analyses without clear communication
Mentioned presenting findings but did not elaborate on storytelling techniques
Displayed some data visualization and presentation skills inconsistently
Clearly articulated strategies for effective data storytelling and communication
Provided highly comprehensive examples covering data-driven storytelling and influence
